alert.note: Alert for Grayson; Hardin; Hart (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 23 at 2:45AM EST until February 24 at 3:10AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CST/345 AM EST/ EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky and SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following counties, in NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Hardin, Larue and Nelson. In SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Grayson and Hart. * WHEN...Until 245 AM CST /345 AM EST/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 145 AM CST /245 AM EST/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elizabethtown, Bardstown, Hodgenville, Clarkson, New Haven, Bloomfield, Upton, Sonora, Bonnieville and Tonieville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
